EPF Composer should have better integration with the Eclipse Resource View. Internally, the tool creates an Eclipse project, called a method library project, for each method library and it supports only one open method library project at any given time. However, in the Resource View, a user can close and open any project. This actions need to be monitored by the tool and appropriate responses should be taken when the user switch back to the Authoring and Browsing perspectives.

Currently, if a user closes the current method library project in the Resource View, then switch back to the Authoring perspective and add a new content package, the following exception is thrown:

Error saving file(s)
  org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileIOException: Could not rename 'D:\EPF_Test\new_plug-in\plugin.xmi' to 'D:\EPF_Test\new_plug-in\_1oJ24ORNEdqQW9uECLjIWAold_QhxFAORLEdqQW9uECLjIWA'
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileXMIResourceImpl.commit(MultiFileXMIResourceImpl.java:658)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MethodLibraryPersister$FailSafePersister.commit(MethodLibraryPersister.java:608)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.command.MethodElementAddCommand.saveModifiedResources(MethodElementAddCommand.java:800)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.command.MethodElementAddCommand$8.run(MethodElementAddCommand.java:960)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.ui.UserInteractionHelper$7.run(UserInteractionHelper.java:571)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

EPF Composer should also assign a default icon to each method library project in the Resource View.

Library's project is checked for open whenever a view or editor that can modify library is activited. If the project is not open, open it.

This should be fixed in the next build after 05/23/2006

Verified in latest build (1.0-M5-N20060829-1815-win32) and fixed.

It seems the project be auto actived when switch back.
